bibliography_entries.line_html: Amann, Émil. Le Protévangile de Jacques et ses remaniements latins. Paris: Letouzey et Ané, 1910 (reprint and translation of Tischendorf’s text, except that he adds the preface as he found it in Chartres 162, pp. 340–64).
bibliography_entries.line_text: Amann, Émil. Le Protévangile de Jacques et ses remaniements latins. Paris: Letouzey et Ané, 1910 (reprint and translation of Tischendorf’s text, except that he adds the preface as he found it in Chartres 162, pp. 340–64).

bibliography_entries.line_html: Beyers, Rita, ed. Libri de nativitate Mariae: Libellus de nativitate sanctae Mariae, textux et commentarius. CCSA 10. Turnhout: Brepols, 1997 (the only modern critical edition of Nat. Mary, based on 93 manuscripts of the A-text, accompanied by a textual apparatus, translation into French, biblical references, and commentary).
bibliography_entries.line_text: Beyers, Rita, ed. Libri de nativitate Mariae: Libellus de nativitate sanctae Mariae, textux et commentarius. CCSA 10. Turnhout: Brepols, 1997 (the only modern critical edition of Nat. Mary, based on 93 manuscripts of the A-text, accompanied by a textual apparatus, translation into French, biblical references, and commentary).

bibliography_entries.line_html: Fabricius, Johann Albert, ed. Codex apocryphus Novi Testamenti. 2 vols. Hamburg: Benjamin Schiller, 1703 (the editio princeps apart from those printings of Nat. Mary among Jerome’s letters, although it is uncertain which manuscripts he used; also includes the first commentary on Nat. Mary, at the foot of the page; vol. 1, pp. 19–38).
bibliography_entries.line_text: Fabricius, Johann Albert, ed. Codex apocryphus Novi Testamenti. 2 vols. Hamburg: Benjamin Schiller, 1703 (the editio princeps apart from those printings of Nat. Mary among Jerome’s letters, although it is uncertain which manuscripts he used; also includes the first commentary on Nat. Mary, at the foot of the page; vol. 1, pp. 19–38).

bibliography_entries.line_html: Jones, Jeremiah. A New and Full Method of Settling the Canonical Authority of the New Testament. 3 vols. London: J. Clark and R. Hett, 1722 (Fabricius’s text with translation, vol. 2, pp. 69–81).
bibliography_entries.line_text: Jones, Jeremiah. A New and Full Method of Settling the Canonical Authority of the New Testament. 3 vols. London: J. Clark and R. Hett, 1722 (Fabricius’s text with translation, vol. 2, pp. 69–81).

bibliography_entries.line_html: Thilo, Johann Karl, ed. Codex apocryphus Novi Testamenti. Leipzig: Vogel, 1832 (largely reliant upon Fabricius’s text, with some variants, but it is uncertain which manuscripts he used; he also relies on Fabricius’s commentary and expands on it, pp. 317–36).
bibliography_entries.line_text: Thilo, Johann Karl, ed. Codex apocryphus Novi Testamenti. Leipzig: Vogel, 1832 (largely reliant upon Fabricius’s text, with some variants, but it is uncertain which manuscripts he used; he also relies on Fabricius’s commentary and expands on it, pp. 317–36).

bibliography_entries.line_html: Tischendorf, Constantin von, ed., Evangelia Apocrypha. Leipzig: Hermann Mendelsohn, 1853 (largely reliant upon Fabricius’s text, although he makes six changes; he notes that two of these come from Florence, Biblioteca Medicea Laurenziana, Gaddianus 208 [not in Beyers’s list of manuscripts], but it is uncertain which other manuscripts he used. In the second edition, Tischendorf makes fourteen additional changes to the text, relying on a certain codex Parisiensis that remains unidentified; pp. 106–14). 2d ed., 1876 (pp. 113–21).
bibliography_entries.line_text: Tischendorf, Constantin von, ed., Evangelia Apocrypha. Leipzig: Hermann Mendelsohn, 1853 (largely reliant upon Fabricius’s text, although he makes six changes; he notes that two of these come from Florence, Biblioteca Medicea Laurenziana, Gaddianus 208 [not in Beyers’s list of manuscripts], but it is uncertain which other manuscripts he used. In the second edition, Tischendorf makes fourteen additional changes to the text, relying on a certain codex Parisiensis that remains unidentified; pp. 106–14). 2d ed., 1876 (pp. 113–21).
